examples.text: Half their machines are lying idle.
He did not let the factory become idle.
The land was left idle for years.
Over ten per cent of the workforce is now idle.
He never stayed idle for long.

definitions.definition: with no particular purpose or effect

examples.text: It was just an **idle threat** *(= not serious)*.
**It is idle to** pretend that their marriage is a success.

definitions.definition: not spent doing work or something particular

examples.text: In idle moments, he carved wooden figures.

definitions.definition: people who do not have enough to do often start to do wrong

examples.text: She blamed the crimes on the local jobless teenagers. ‘The devil makes work for idle hands,’ she would say.

wordOrigin: Old English īdel ‘empty, useless’, of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch ijdel ‘vain, frivolous, useless’ and German eitel ‘bare, worthless’.
